ON PETITION FOR REHEARING
Rehearing denied.
SHEPARD, Chief Justice, concurring in part and dissenting in part.
I join in the Court's denial of rehearing in 4447 Corporation v. Goldsmith, 504 N.E.2d 559, though I take a somewhat different view of the case. However, I would grant rehearing in Fort Wayne Books v. State and vacate the trial court's seizure order.
The two cases which have been consolidated for consideration of their common legal issues differ substantially in the degree to which the State has afforded the defendants opportunity for a hearing on the merits underlying the seizure of their property. The importance of such an opportunity has long been recognized by the Court as a part of due process:
